comments:
Platform: Solaris 9 GTK
Build: Eclipse 3.1M6

- Start Eclipse with a new workspace
- From the main welcome page, click What's New
- Click the Eclipse community link.

The following exception is created:

All the other links on this page works find. My netscape brower comes up with 
correct information.

Open 'General>Web Browser' preference page. Do you see any external browser 
currently selected? It is possible that we failed to find a browser on your 
machine.

Can you tell us where is the browser installed so that we can update our list?

When I open the 'General>Web Browser' preference page, I found that the 'Use 
external Web brower' is selected but no browser is listed. The 'Use internal 
web brower selection is grayed out.

I am using the Netscape brower. I have Netscape in the path so it can be access 
everywhere. If I click on other links in "What's New" Welcome page, Netscape 
will automatic comes up to display the info except the Eclipse community link. 
Do I always have to put Netscape on to the 'General>Web Browser' preference 
page from now on? If I just do that and remove Netscape from the path, will 
other links work?

As a quick workaround, add a browser to the list of external browsers manually 
so that we can have one to use.

Also append the physical location of netscape of your machine from root. 

We may add another radio button that would use the system browser but use 
system default.
Fixed and tagged for this week's I-build.
